parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>False. There is no CMF number present in the provided post.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>False. The post does not refer to any specific parliamentary candidate by name, surname, or any other clear identifier.  The image is allegorical and doesn't mention any specific candidate.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>True. The post is a paid advertisement on Facebook, a public platform, and the content is designed to reach a wide audience, not just a specific individual or small group.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>False. While the post touches upon political dynamics in Romania, its primary objective is not to influence the vote for any particular candidate in the parliamentary elections. The content focuses on geopolitical manipulation and political dynamics, a general political commentary, not a specific electoral campaign.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>True. The post appears to be an attempt at journalistic commentary or analysis of geopolitical influences on Romanian politics. The image is a visual metaphor for this analysis.  It aims to inform and present a perspective, not to directly advocate for or against any candidate.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>False. The post doesn't express a personal opinion unrelated to the electoral process. It presents an analysis of a political situation, which is different from expressing a personal viewpoint.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>1178332110506852</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The Facebook post, while dealing with a political topic relevant to Romania, does not constitute electoral propaganda under Article 98 t) of LEGE nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015.  The post does not explicitly endorse or oppose any specific candidate participating in the parliamentary elections. The image is an allegorical representation of geopolitical influences, not a direct appeal for votes. The content is more akin to political commentary or analysis than an attempt to sway public opinion towards a particular candidate.  The lack of any direct reference to specific candidates or parties, combined with the general nature of the analysis, suggests that the post does not violate the law.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>FALSE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates/>
<responsible-party-or-group>Ez Stiri Altfel</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police/>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
